etymology.description: Depicts fired earthenware pottery or a tile
etymology.interpretation: The character 瓦(wǎ) represents the shape of a piece of earthenware, capturing the essence of pottery or tiles, which were basic elements in early Chinese construction and daily life.

examples.english: The old craftsman carefully fires the earthenware.

examples.chinese: 这座老房子用瓦(瓦)，给人温馨的感觉(給人溫馨的感覺)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò lǎo fángzi yòng wǎ, gěi rén wēnxīn de gǎnjué.
examples.english: This old house uses earthenware, giving a warm feeling.

examples.chinese: 古镇小巷旁边的摊位贩卖精美瓦(瓦)，吸引了四方游客(吸引了四方遊客)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ zhèn xiǎo xiàng pángbiān de tānwèi fànmài jīngměi wǎ, xīyǐn le sìfāng yóukè.
examples.english: A stall selling exquisite earthenware beside the ancient town alley attracts tourists from all over.
